author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Along with other gases, methane can dissolve into the water supply.  Typically found at concentrations of 1 milligram per litre, but can sometimes get higher if there are methane leaks underground.
As it comes through the tap, it degasses and builds up in the local area so a lit match will "set the tap water alight"

Source video: https://youtu.be/4LBjSXWQRV8?t=27

title: Why is This Water on Fire?
